Events.text: Nika riots in Constantinople: A quarrel between supporters of different chariot teams—the Blues and the Greens—in the Hippodrome escalates into violence.
Events.html: Nika riots in Constantinople: A quarrel between supporters of different chariot teams—the Blues and the Greens—in the Hippodrome escalates into violence.

Events.text: Emperor Tai Zong of the Khitan-led Liao Dynasty invades the Later Jin, resulting in the destruction of the Later Jin.
Events.html: Emperor Tai Zong of the Khitan-led Liao Dynasty invades the Later Jin, resulting in the destruction of the Later Jin.

Events.text: Theodora is crowned empress of the Byzantine Empire.
Events.html: Theodora is crowned empress of the Byzantine Empire.

Events.text: Vladislaus II, Duke of Bohemia becomes king of Bohemia.
Events.html: Vladislaus II, Duke of Bohemia becomes king of Bohemia.

Events.text: First recorded lottery in England.
Events.html: First recorded lottery in England.

Events.text: Austrian nobility is granted freedom of religion.
Events.html: Austrian nobility is granted freedom of religion.

Events.text: A powerful earthquake destroys parts of Sicily and Malta.
Events.html: A powerful earthquake destroys parts of Sicily and Malta.

Events.text: In Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, the first American life insurance company is incorporated.
Events.html: In Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, the first American life insurance company is incorporated.

Events.text: Ching-Thang Khomba is crowned King of Manipur.
Events.html: Ching-Thang Khomba is crowned King of Manipur.

Events.text: William Herschel discovers Titania and Oberon, two moons of Uranus.
Events.html: William Herschel discovers Titania and Oberon, two moons of Uranus.

links.title: Timeline of discovery of Solar System planets and their moons

Events.text: The Michigan Territory is created.
Events.html: The Michigan Territory is created.

Events.text: Alabama secedes from the United States.
Events.html: Alabama secedes from the United States.

Events.text: American Civil War: Battle of Arkansas Post: General John McClernand and Admiral David Dixon Porter capture the Arkansas River for the Union.
Events.html: American Civil War: Battle of Arkansas Post: General John McClernand and Admiral David Dixon Porter capture the Arkansas River for the Union.

Events.text: American Civil War: CSS Alabama encounters and sinks the USS Hatteras off Galveston Lighthouse in Texas.
Events.html: 1863 – American Civil War: CSS Alabama encounters and sinks the USS Hatteras off Galveston Lighthouse in Texas.

Events.text: The Anglo-Zulu War begins.
Events.html: The Anglo-Zulu War begins.

Events.text: Grand Canyon National Monument is created.
Events.html: Grand Canyon National Monument is created.

Events.text: Immigrant textile works in Lawrence, Massachusetts, go on strike when wages are reduced in response to a mandated shortening of the work week.
Events.html: Immigrant textile works in Lawrence, Massachusetts, go on strike when wages are reduced in response to a mandated shortening of the work week.

Events.text: The Kingsland munitions factory explosion occurs as a result of sabotage.
Events.html: The Kingsland munitions factory explosion occurs as a result of sabotage.

Events.text: First use of insulin to treat diabetes in a human patient.
Events.html: First use of insulin to treat diabetes in a human patient.

Events.text: Occupation of the Ruhr: Troops from France and Belgium occupy the Ruhr area to force Germany to make its World War I reparation payments.
Events.html: Occupation of the Ruhr: Troops from France and Belgium occupy the Ruhr area to force Germany to make its World War I reparation payments.

Events.text: Louis B. Mayer, head of film studio Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM), announces the creation of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, at a banquet in Los Angeles, California.
Events.html: Louis B. Mayer, head of film studio Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM), announces the creation of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, at a banquet in Los Angeles, California.

links.title: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

Events.text: Amelia Earhart becomes the first person to fly solo from Hawaii to California.
Events.html: Amelia Earhart becomes the first person to fly solo from Hawaii to California.

Events.text: World War II: The Japanese capture Kuala Lumpur.
Events.html: World War II: The Japanese capture Kuala Lumpur.

Events.text: World War II: The Japanese attack Tarakan in Borneo, Netherlands Indies (Battle of Tarakan)
Events.html: 1942 – World War II: The Japanese attack Tarakan in Borneo, Netherlands Indies (Battle of Tarakan)

Events.text: The Republic of China agrees to the Sino-British New Equal Treaty and the Sino-American New Equal Treaty.
Events.html: The Republic of China agrees to the Sino-British New Equal Treaty and the Sino-American New Equal Treaty.

Events.text: Italian-American anarchist Carlo Tresca is assassinated in New York City.
Events.html: 1943 – Italian-American anarchist Carlo Tresca is assassinated in New York City.

Events.text: Enver Hoxha, Secretary General of the Communist Party of Albania, declares the People's Republic of Albania with himself as head of state.
Events.html: Enver Hoxha, Secretary General of the Communist Party of Albania, declares the People's Republic of Albania with himself as head of state.

Events.text: The first "networked" television broadcasts took place as KDKA-TV in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania goes on the air connecting the east coast and mid-west programming.
Events.html: The first "networked" television broadcasts took place as KDKA-TV in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania goes on the air connecting the east coast and mid-west programming.

Events.text: The African Convention is founded in Dakar, Senegal.
Events.html: The African Convention is founded in Dakar, Senegal.

Events.text: Throgs Neck Bridge over the East River, linking New York City's boroughs of The Bronx and Queens, opens to road traffic.
Events.html: Throgs Neck Bridge over the East River, linking New York City's boroughs of The Bronx and Queens, opens to road traffic.

Events.text: Cold War: While tied to its pier in Polyarny, the Soviet submarine B-37 is destroyed when fire breaks out in its torpedo compartment.
Events.html: Cold War: While tied to its pier in Polyarny, the Soviet submarine B-37 is destroyed when fire breaks out in its torpedo compartment.

Events.text: An avalanche on Huascarán in Peru causes around 4,000 deaths.
Events.html: 1962 – An avalanche on Huascarán in Peru causes around 4,000 deaths.

Events.text: Surgeon General of the United States Dr. Luther Terry, M.D., publishes the landmark report Smoking and Health: Report of the Advisory Committee to the Surgeon General of the United States saying that smoking may be hazardous to health, sparking national and worldwide anti-smoking efforts.
Events.html: Surgeon General of the United States Dr. Luther Terry, M.D., publishes the landmark report Smoking and Health: Report of the Advisory Committee to the Surgeon General of the United States saying that smoking may be hazardous to health, sparking national and worldwide anti-smoking efforts.

links.title: Surgeon General of the United States
Smoking and Health: Report of the Advisory Committee to the Surgeon General of the United States

Events.text: East Pakistan renames itself Bangladesh.
Events.html: East Pakistan renames itself Bangladesh.

Events.text: Major League Baseball owners vote in approval of the American League adopting the designated hitter position.
Events.html: Major League Baseball owners vote in approval of the American League adopting the designated hitter position.

Events.text: The Gateway Bridge, Brisbane, Queensland, Australia is officially opened.
Events.html: The Gateway Bridge, Brisbane, Queensland, Australia is officially opened.

Events.text: The Irish Government announces the end of a 15-year broadcasting ban on the IRA and its political arm Sinn Féin.
Events.html: The Irish Government announces the end of a 15-year broadcasting ban on the IRA and its political arm Sinn Féin.

Events.text: Space Shuttle program: STS-72 launches from the Kennedy Space Center marking the start of the 74th Space Shuttle mission and the 10th flight of Endeavour.
Events.html: Space Shuttle program: STS-72 launches from the Kennedy Space Center marking the start of the 74th Space Shuttle mission and the 10th flight of Endeavour.

Events.text: Over 100 people are killed in the Sidi-Hamed massacre in Algeria.
Events.html: Over 100 people are killed in the Sidi-Hamed massacre in Algeria.

Events.text: Illinois Governor George Ryan commutes the death sentences of 167 prisoners on Illinois's death row based on the Jon Burge scandal.
Events.html: Illinois Governor George Ryan commutes the death sentences of 167 prisoners on Illinois's death row based on the Jon Burge scandal.

Events.text: One French soldier and 17 militants are killed in a failed attempt to free a French hostage in Bulo Marer, Somalia.
Events.html: One French soldier and 17 militants are killed in a failed attempt to free a French hostage in Bulo Marer, Somalia.
